intro: Hedyotis schlechteri var. acuminata, commonly known as the acute-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are often acute or pointed at the tips. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes. The species is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas.
